Questions.question: Which planet is known as the 'Morning Star' or 'Evening Star'?
Questions.information: Venus is often referred to as the 'Morning Star' when it appears in the morning and as the 'Evening Star' when it appears in the evening.

Questions.question: What is the smallest prime number?
Questions.information: 2 is the smallest prime number, as it is only divisible by 1 and itself.

Questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
Questions.information: The chemical symbol for gold is 'Au,' derived from the Latin word 'aurum.'

Questions.question: Who is known as the 'Father of Modern Physics'?
Questions.information: Albert Einstein is often referred to as the 'Father of Modern Physics' for his groundbreaking work in the field.

Questions.question: What gas do plants primarily release during photosynthesis?
Questions.information: Plants primarily release oxygen during photosynthesis.

Questions.question: Which famous scientist formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation?
Questions.information: Isaac Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.

Questions.question: What is the national flower of Japan?
Questions.information: The national flower of Japan is the Cherry Blossom or 'Sakura.'

Questions.question: In which year did Christopher Columbus first voyage to the Americas?
Questions.information: Christopher Columbus first voyaged to the Americas in 1492.

Questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
Questions.information: The Blue Whale is the largest mammal on Earth.

Questions.question: Which gas is known as the 'silent killer' due to its odorless and colorless nature?
Questions.information: Carbon monoxide is often called the 'silent killer' because it is odorless and colorless.

Questions.question: Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
Questions.information: Mars is often referred to as the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance.

Questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for silver?
Questions.information: The chemical symbol for silver is 'Ag,' derived from the Latin word 'argentum.'

Questions.question: Who wrote the novel '1984'?
Questions.information: The novel '1984' was written by George Orwell and published in 1949.

Questions.question: Which gas do humans primarily exhale when they breathe out?
Questions.information: Humans primarily exhale carbon dioxide when they breathe out.
